Detailed Description

The CallForwardingHandler is a SS handler responsible for modifying the Call Forwarding SS. This includes registering and erasing numbers for specific services, activating and deactivating those services as well as interrogating their current status. The handler provides various methods with different parameter signatures for these purposes. The call forwarding supplementary service consists of this set of subservices:
  • all call forwardings
  • unconditionally forward the call
  • all conditional call forwardings
  • forward the call if the subscriber is busy
  • forward the call if the subscriber does not pick up
  • forward the call if the subsicriber is not reachable
Therefore the desired subservice or subservice group has to specified.

Member Function Documentation

SsApiRc CallForwardingHandler::Activate (  SsCode  ss_code,
ServiceGroup  basic_service = AllServices,
const WString  override_ss_seq = L"",
BOOLEAN  register_only = FALSE,
LineSelector  line = InvalidLine
) 
 

Activates call forwarding.
Activates the given call forwarding kind and optionally for a specific basic service group.
Only call forwardings which were registered beforehand may be activated this way.
This method triggers sending of *<code dependend on parameter>*<mmi_code># to the mobile network. The actual function is delegated to the ExecuteRequest.

Parameters:
ss_code The supplementary service code describing the desired service (all call forwardings, conditional call forwardings, etc.).
basic_service The basic service group of the request (all services, all teleservices, etc.), defaults to all services.
override_ss_seq Supplementary Service request string to be sent to net, overrides handler generated request string.
register_only A flag that indicates if the request is sent to the GSM stack or only registered at SsMainHandler.
Returns:
Any code ExecuteRequest might return.

SsApiRc CallForwardingHandler::Activate (  SsCode  ss_code,
const PhoneNumber &  number,
UINT  time_out = 0,
const WString  override_ss_seq = L"",
BOOLEAN  register_only = FALSE,
LineSelector  line = InvalidLine
) 
 

Activates call forwarding.
Activates the given call forwarding kind for all basic service groups.
This call includes the registration with the specified phone number and if applicable time out. This method triggers sending of *<code dependend on parameter>*<number>**<time_out># to the mobile network. The actual function is delegated to the ExecuteRequest.

Parameters:
ss_code The supplementary service code describing the desired service (all call forwardings, conditional call forwardings, etc.).
number The phone number to set the call forwarding to.
override_ss_seq Supplementary Service request string to be sent to net, overrides handler generated request string.
time_out The time out needed for call forwarding on no answer if applicable, defaults to 0.
Returns:
Any code ExecuteRequest might return.

CallForwardingHandlerId

SsBaseHandler::ReturnCode CallForwardingHandler::ProcessStackMsgArgument (  const SsStackMsgArgument &  arg  )  [protected, virtual]
 

This method is called by the SsDispatcher upon receiving a StackMsgArgument. The method checks whether the given argument is processable in any way (contains correct data), creates a new message object using the appropriate Create*Msg methods and stores the message by means of its superclass.

Parameters:
arg The wrapper object which should contain either a SsForwardingIndArg, a SsInterrogateIndArg or a SsRetResIndArg to be processed.
Returns:
OkNoMessage - if a message was created,
TipdMismatch - if the tipd of the argument does not match the tipd of the current transaction,
OperationCodeMismatch - if the argument's operation code does not match the expected operation code associated with the initial request,
UnexpectedSsCode - if the supplementary service code is not of a call forwarding kind,
UnexpectedArgument - if the argument is not either a SsForwardingIndArg, SsInterrogateIndArg or a SsRetResIndArg,
or any other code the Create*Msg methods might return.
See also:
SsBaseHandler

SsDispatcher

SsApiRc CallForwardingHandler::Register (  SsCode  ss_code,
ServiceGroup  basic_service,
const PhoneNumber &  number,
UINT  time_out = 0,
const WString  override_ss_seq = L"",
BOOLEAN  register_only = FALSE,
LineSelector  line = InvalidLine
) 
 

Registers call forwarding.
Registers the given call forwarding kind for a specific basic service group with the specified phone number and if applicable time out.
This method triggers sending of **<code dependend on parameter>*<number>*<mmi_code>*<time_out># to the mobile network. The actual function is delegated to the ExecuteRequest.

Parameters:
ss_code The supplementary service code describing the desired service (all call forwardings, conditional call forwardings, etc.).
basic_service The basic service group of the request (all services, all teleservices, etc.), defaults to all services.
number The phone number to set the call forwarding to.
override_ss_seq Supplementary Service request string to be sent to net, overrides handler generated request string.
time_out The time out needed for call forwarding on no answer if applicable, defaults to 0.
register_only A flag that indicates if the request is sent to the GSM stack or only registered at SsMainHandler.
Returns:
InvalidPhoneNumber - if the phone number is empty or otherwise illegal,
or any other code ExecuteRequest might return.
